movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

Brave Bird and Knock Off are staples. The former smashes through common threats such as Scraggy and Mienfoo and even 2HKOes a lot of threats that don't resist it with its sheer power. Knock Off is a utility option that can 2HKO standard Slowpoke and weaken other opposing walls for Doduo's teammates. Return is a secondary STAB option for hitting Chinchou, but if recoil isn't an issue, you can use Double-Edge. Pursuit is here for revenge killing key opposing Pokemon so that they won't cause you trouble later. Hidden Power Fighting is useful for KOing Pawniard, but it also does solid damage to Magnemite.

Set Details

The EV spread is simple as Doduo's main aim is to hit hard and fast. The main nature on this set is Adamant, as Doduo doesn't have Life Orb for power anymore. Naughty should be used with Hidden Power Fighting. Use Jolly for outspeeding Timid Choice Scarf Chinchou, Jolly Choice Scarf Mienfoo, and Speed tying with Choice Scarf Gastly; while they aren't that common, they can be an issue. Early Bird is still the only reasonable ability choice.

Usage Tips

Use Pursuit against those threats that the opponent will probably switch out such as Abra and Gastly. Note that Pursuit can be used against more than Ghost- and Psychic-type Pokemon. For example, Pursuit can trap any opposing threat that your opponent doesn't want to lose like spinners, clerics, hazard setters, and so on. Again, exercise caution when switching Doduo in; in this regard, take advantage of Doduo's Ghost- and Ground-type immunities. Doduo should be used for revenge killing specific targets such as Choice Scarf Pawniard and +1 Scraggy or Choice Scarf Scraggy. Volt Switch and U-turn are good ways to bring Doduo into battle safely. Use it late-game or to revenge kill.

Team Options

Chinchou makes a great partner, bringing Doduo into battle and KOing some of its counters such as Tirtouga. Drilbur is good to remove and set up Stealth Rock while dealing with Steel-types. This set is better able to deal with Pawniard than the Life Orb one as Choice Scarf Pawniard is currently the most common variant. Cottonee is another good teammate; it can lock the opposing Pokemon into a Ground- or a Ghost-type move so Doduo can come into battle safely. Cottonee easily KOes Tirtouga, a very common Doduo counter. Doduo can form very good offensive cores with Pokemon weak to Fighting-types like Pawniard; Pawniard supports Doduo by Knocking Off opposing Eviolites. Finally, Archen can remove Stealth Rock and break the core of Chinchou + Pawniard.

movesets.name: Life Orb Bird

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Brave Bird is an obligatory STAB move that smashes anything which doesn't resist it, especially top threats such as Scraggy, Cottonee, and Mienfoo; even walls that don't resist it are 2HKOed, such as Porygon. Knock Off is used for supporting the team and it 2HKOes standard Slowpoke. Quick Attack is an important way to revenge kill threats such as Fletchling, Croagunk, and Timburr without fearing their priority moves; after an opposing Pokemon switches into Doduo and takes Brave Bird damage, Quick Attack lets Doduo KO it before it can act the next turn. Hidden Power Fighting is basically for KOing Pawniard, but it also does solid damage to Magnemite. Return is a secondary STAB option for hitting Electric-types such as Chinchou.

Set Details

The EV spread is used for always hitting hard and fast. Jolly gives Doduo an above-average Speed tier. Naive is used with Hidden Power Fighting. Early Bird is the best of Doduo's three abilities; it can be useful for waking up early in case Doduo switches into a sleep-inducing move, like Foongus's Spore. Life Orb allows Doduo to act as a wallbreaker.

Usage Tips

Avoid switching in Doduo if you aren't sure if it will be into a Ghost- or Ground-type move. Use Doduo late-game when its counters are already KOed or to revenge kill something weak to Brave Bird as most Pokemon can't easily switch into Doduo's Brave Bird late-game. Volt Switch and U-turn are safe ways to bring Doduo into battle. Spam Knock Off early-game so Doduo's offensive teammates may have an easier time sweeping.

Team Options

Chinchou forms a very good core with Doduo; it can safely bring Doduo into battle with Volt Swich. Drilbur is another good partner as it can both set up Stealth Rock and use Rapid Spin. Drilbur KOes Rock- and Steel-types, and Chinchou KOes Rock-types too. Doduo KOes both Drilbur's and Chinchou's counters, especially Grass-types. In general, Doduo can form very good offensive cores with Pokemon weak to Fighting-types, like Pawniard; Pawniard supports Doduo by Knocking Off opposing Eviolites. Finally, Doduo forms another good offensive core with Archen. Archen has access to Defog, and they KO each other's counters. Earthquake breaks the Chinchou + Pawniard core which causes a lot of trouble to Doduo.

moves.name: Acupressure
moves.description: Boosts a random stat by 2 stages.

moves.name: Aerial Ace
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Agility
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Air Cutter
moves.description: High critical hit rate.

moves.name: Assurance
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe takes damage in the same turn, before the attack hits.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brave Bird
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil damage.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double Hit
moves.description: Hits 2 times in one turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Drill Peck
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Echoed Voice
moves.description: Power increases when used consecutively.

moves.name: Endeavor
moves.description: Lowers the target's HP to the user's HP.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Flail
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Fly
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Fury Attack
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Growl
moves.description: Lowers target's Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Haze
moves.description: Eliminates all stat changes.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mirror Move
moves.description: Uses the last move that hit the user.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Peck
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Pluck
moves.description: Uses foe's Berry.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Pursuit
moves.description: Doubles in power if the target switches, and hits them before they can escape.

moves.name: Quick Attack
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Rage
moves.description: Boosts Atk 1 stage if hit.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Roost
moves.description: Heals 50% HP. Temporarily removes the user's Flying-type.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Sky Attack
moves.description: Hits the turn after being used.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Steel Wing
moves.description: 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Supersonic
moves.description: Confuses the foe.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thrash
moves.description: Repeats for 2-3 turns. Confuses the user.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Tri Attack
moves.description: 20% chance to burn, freeze, or paralyze.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.description: Repeats for 2-5 turns. No Pokemon can sleep during these turns.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Increases the chance of successfully escaping battle with a wild Pokemon.
